Dear Tishara Price:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. No
substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way, at (517) 243-9743.

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000050
Special Investigation Intake Date: October 22, 2024
License #: CP500201269
Licensee Group Organization: Michigan Department of Health and Human
Services
Licensee Designee: Demetrius LuJuan Starling
Chief Administrator: Tishara Price
Agency Name: MACOMB COUNTY DHHS
Agency Address: 44777 N Gratiot Ave
Clinton Township, MI 48036-1362
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 09/20/2026
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section • (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has
Description ongoing contact with children or parents to be a person
who has the ability, experience, education, and training to
perform the duties assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Agency did not follow up on reported concerns that a youth is
placed in an unsafe environment.
Investigation Foster Care Supervisor 1 (FC Supervisor 1) was interviewed
via telephone on October 30, 2024. She stated she has no
concern regarding substance abuse of Caregiver. There have
never been any safety concerns expressed throughout the case.
Caregiver is like family to Youth A as he has been in her care for
over a year. Youth A is attending school and therapy on a regular
basis and there have not been any concerns noted. The assigned
foster care worker is scheduled to conduct a home visit the
following day and the agency will be sure to proactively set up a
safety plan regarding substance use. She stated she doesn’t have
any knowledge of Caregiver dating anyone, but this will also be
discussed during the home visit to ensure that clearances are
completed regarding anyone having regular contact with Youth A.
Ideas were discussed to ensure the agency is aware of all
individuals residing in the home. This includes, unannounced
visits, interviewing Youth A to inquire who visits the home and/or
stays the night, and observation of items in the home during home
visits such as men’s clothing or belongings.
Foster Care Worker 1 (FCW1) was interviewed via telephone
on October 30, 2024. She stated she is new to the agency, the
case and child welfare overall. She has been assigned since the
beginning of September 2024. She stated she has been to the
home once for a home visit. During her initial home visit,
Caregiver indicated her adult son had recently moved out of the
home so there should not be anyone else residing there. She has
a home visit scheduled on October 31, 2024 and will be sure to
inquire and observe anything that would indicate whether or not
Caregiver has a living together partner who is residing in the
home.
2

FCW1 stated she has not had anyone report any concerns
regarding paternal relatives. She clarified maternal relatives are
interested in adoption and are a competing party to the adoption.
A follow up telephone call occurred with FCW1 on November 7,
2024. She stated she conducted an unannounced home visit with
Caregiver and did not observe anything that indicated there were
additional household members and Caregiver has never
mentioned dating anyone. In addition, there was no evidence of
substance use or abuse during the unannounced home visit. She
stated she proactively safety planned regarding substance use
during her regularly scheduled home visit that occurred on
October 31, 2024. Youth A was not present during the
unannounced visit, but Youth A has stated there were no changes
to the home’s household members.
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on October 31,
2024. She stated she did a little bit of investigating and Youth A
being placed in Caregiver’s home is no longer a concern. Her
main concern is DHHS continues to place Youth A in locations
where he is not safe but stated he is safe with Caregiver. She
stated she has not heard any concerns regarding Caregiver and
her living together partner drinking or using drugs, but later stated
she heard Caregiver’s living together partner is an alcoholic. She
stated she believes she knows the first name of the living together
partner but is unsure of the last name. She had heard the
information on Caregiver’s living together partner from another
person. No other details were provided.
Complainant stated concerns were previously reported to the
agency regarding Youth A’s placement during a meeting in
August, 2024. In addition, she stated she had previously reported
concerns to FCW2 and asked if he checked the closets in the
home to see if there was any sign of someone else residing there
but there was no follow up.
She is concerned Youth A is allowed contact and communication
with paternal relatives, but this is not occurring with maternal
relatives. Complainant was not able to provide names of paternal
relatives Youth A is having contact with. Complainant expressed
concerns Caregiver is keeping Youth A away from maternal
relatives he has known his whole life and showing preferential
treatment with paternal relatives who Caregiver has known for a
long time.
3

Foster Care Supervisor 2 (FC Supervisor 2) was interviewed
via telephone on October 31, 2024. She stated during her
involvement with the case there were never any concerns
reported regarding Caregiver and substance abuse or her ability
to meet the needs of Youth A. She stated it was not reported or
noted Caregiver had a partner or of anyone residing with her other
than Youth A and her adult son for a period of time and there were
no reports of concern regarding her adult son.
FC Supervisor 2 stated Biological Mother expressed concerns
regarding Youth A’s interactions and communication with paternal
relatives. She clarified all contact was supervised. Biological
Mother had reported no relatives for the majority of the case until
termination. Maternal grandmother contacted DHHS regarding
concerns and expressed interest in adoption. She stated Youth A
has not had contact with maternal relatives, so the agency started
communication through Youth A’s therapist and those have
continued. FC Supervisor 2 stated Caregiver has complied and is
not fighting the contact.
FC Supervisor 2 has communicated with FC Supervisor 1 and the
agency is notifying the kinship worker of updates in order to
assess the home study and gather necessary information if the
allegations Caregiver’s living together partner is residing there are
true. She clarified that this information is not something they were
aware of.
She recalls some concerns regarding Caregiver, but she stated it
wasn’t anything regarding substance abuse or additional
household members and nothing that required a safety plan or for
her to step in and address.
Documents reviewed:
• Caregiver provider record: Initial emergency DHS 5770
completed 2/1/24. Additional household members:
biological son. Central Registry clearance, criminal history
check and MPSOR check on 1/31/2024. Youth A placed on
2/5/2024.
• Youth A MISACWIS case file:
2/23/2024 ISP: Youth A’s adjustment to placement. Youth
A is familiar with Caregiver.
5/30/2024 social work contact: Youth A visits paternal
grandfather weekly. Paternal great aunt will watch Youth A
while caregiver is at work.
8/13/2024 SWC: Biological Mother expressed concern
during Family Team Meeting regarding Youth A’s
placement and interactions with paternal relatives. She was
4

advised by FCW2 to address her concerns with her
attorney as necessary clearances/home study were
completed prior to Youth A being placed in Caregiver’s
home. Also states paternal aunt provides childcare while
caregiver works.
9/26/2024 social work contact: Caregiver provided contact
information for maternal great aunt and maternal grandma
and directed to call them this weekend and establish phone
contact with them and Youth A. Youth A attends therapy
weekly and no concerns noted.
10/31/2024 social work contact. Home visit in placement.
No concerns noted. No evidence of substance abuse or
additional people residing in the home. FCW2 safety
planned regarding substances.
11/7/2024 social work contact. FCW2 conducted an
unannounced home visit. No concerns or indications of
substance use or other individuals residing in the home.
• Agency assignments:
FC Supervisor 2-primary foster care supervisor 2/5/2024-
9/6/2024
FCW2-primary foster care worker 2/5/2024-9/6/2024
FC Supervisor 1-primary foster care supervisor 9/6/24-
present
FCW1-primary foster care worker 9/6/24-present
Analysis The agency is found in compliance. Based on interviews and
review of Youth A’s MISACWIS case file there is no evidence to
support concerns regarding substance abuse or that caregiver has
additional household members residing in the home who were not
reported to and cleared by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
5

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
